style.name: German-Style Schwarzbier
style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. This is not a fullbodied beer, but rather a moderate body gently enhances malt flavor and aroma with low to moderate levels of sweetness. Hop bitterness is low to medium in character. Noble-type hop flavor and aroma should be low but perceptible. There should be no fruity esters. Diacetyl should not be perceived.

breweries.description: Local microbrewery/pub. Brew house on premise with a 70 seat pub. 10 rotating taps and 2 handpulls. Simple and delicious menu includes fresh made pizza, oven-baked sandwiches and snacks made in house! Get some Great Local Beer!!!!

data.name: Black Radish Beer
data.description: Black Radish (Schwarzbier) is a medium bodied, dark German lager style beer. Clean lager character with an aftertaste that tends to dry out slowly and linger, featuring hop bitterness with a complementary but subtle roastiness in the background. Black Radish is listed as "one of the 50 beers to try before you die."

breweries.name: Weeping Radish Farm Brewery
breweries.description:
The Weeping Radish is the Oldest Microbrewery in North Carolina. 25 years ago it was illegal for breweries to sell their own beer directly to consumers; they had to go through a distributor. This made it impossible for microbreweries or small brewpubs to exist. In 1985 Uli Bennewitz went to his local senator and together they passed a bill allowing microbreweries to sell their own beer on site. A year later on the July 4th, 1986 the Weeping Radish Brewery opened for business. 
 
Raised in a small village in Bavaria, Uli was determined to bring the high quality beer he was used to across the ocean to North Carolina. A Master Brewer came over from Germany and brewed the first batches of Corolla Gold, Fest, and Black Radish. Strictly adhering to the Reinheitsgebot Purity Law of 1516, all Weeping Radish beers are brewed using hops, malt, yeast and water â€“ no additives, chemicals or preservatives. 
 
Our beer list has expanded over the years and currently on draft in the pub we have the OBX KÃ¶lsch, IPA 25, and Radler as well as our original Corolla Gold, Fest and Black Radish. And for those of you with a sweet tooth we make a fantastic Root Beer!

breweries.name: Brewyard Beer Company LLC
breweries.description: Brewyard Beer Company is dedicated to brewing unique and fresh high-quality artisanal beers in the city of Glendale.  We take pride in the art of brewing, with the utmost attention to detail, from sourcing the best ingredients to pouring the perfect pint.

data.name: Black Thunder
data.description:
If a stout and a pilsner had a lovechild, it would be Black Thunder. It would also be a miracle, because beer can’t “get it on.” This miniature powder keg starts with a roasted, bread-like complexity but finishes dry and clean like a pilsner. It’s dark, distinctive, and dry.

Gold:  2013 GABF (German-style Schwarzbier)
Gold:  2013 AmeriCAN Festival (Specialty Category)
Bronze:  2013 World Beer Cup (German-style Schwarzbier)


HOPS: German Magnum, Tettnanger, Saaz, Hallertau
MALTS: Pils, C-60, Chocolate Wheat, Debittered Black
YEAST: Urquell Lager

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

breweries.name: DuClaw Brewing Company
breweries.description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.

breweries.name: Excel Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Excel Brewing Company runs a 20 BBL brewhouse. The brewery is a division of Excel Bottling Company. Once up and running, we will offer co-packing for the St. Louis regional craft beers.

Excel Bottling Company was founded in 1936 by the Meier Family. The company bottles more than 10 flavors of old-fashioned sodas including “Ski” soda. Each soda flavor is manufactured using pure cane sugar and most often packaged in eco-friendly, returnable glass bottles. In 2012, Excel Bottling Company embarked on a new bottling venture in the craft beer business serving Illinois and Missouri. Excel Bottling Company is headquartered in Breese, Ill. Visit www.excelbrewing.com for more information.

breweries.name: Capital Brewery
breweries.description:
Located in a former egg processing plant building, Capital Brewery produced its first brew at 6:30 pm, April 17, 1986.

The brewhouse features two copper brewing kettles. These units, now over 50 years old, were originally used at the former Hoxter Brewery located in Germany.

At the heart of the operation is a group of loyal and hard working employees dedicated to producing the high quality beer that Capital Brewery is known for.

Most of the beers brewed here at Capital consist of traditional ingredients, water, malted barley and wheat, hops and yeast. However, we do believe in experimentation to develop unique beer styles and varieties. We invite you to enjoy one of our beers in our brewery or take some home for a true Capital experience.


Capital Brewery was established with an important mission in mind, and we continually build on that sentiment, by delivering a unique experience and award winning beers to meet the changing demands of the craft beer community.

breweries.name: Lonerider Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We opened our doors on January 23rd, 2009 and since then we have been impressed with the enthusiasm of craft beer aficionados we meet daily. The craft brewing industry is booming and you can find a tremendous variety out there. North Carolina has undoubtedly become the Southern State for beer with Asheville reigning supreme and Raleigh/Durham/CH not far behind. We hope you continue to support the variety and encourage new brewers to experiment with and craft new styles for everybody’s pleasure.

"Effect change; don't be an audience. Walk your own path, and instead of thinking outside the box, imagine if there was no box."

data.name: Bryan's Bowler Black Lager
data.description: This beer is a deep, dark black much like an old bowler hat. It is named after William Jennings Bryan, former Nebraska statesman and, egads, a prohibitionist to boot. Well we hope ol' Billy Boy is spinning in his grave right now because otherwise, you wouldn't be drinking this beer!!

breweries.name: Ploughshare Brewing Co.
breweries.description: The brewery identity authentically reflects Nebraska history… homestead ideals of hard work, self-sufficiency, simple pleasures and wholesome refreshment. Ploughshare offers a rotation of our hand-crafted beer on 12 taps. We have four year-round brews and many adventurous seasonals released throughout the year.  Every other week, we showcase a cask of naturally-conditioned Ploughshare beer, usually with an unusual spicing or hop addition.  Every once in a while we release a hand-bottled super-premium brew from our conditioning tanks or barrel program. We are currently distributed in Eastern Nebraska.

breweries.name: Chattanooga Brewing Company
breweries.description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.

breweries.name: Stuttgarter Lokalbrauerei Calwer-Eck-Bräu
breweries.description:
When the Calwer Eck opened in 1987 it had been Stuttgart's first micro brewery and one among only a few in Germany. Since that day we are brewing the Calwer-Eck-Bräu following our own recipe. It is a bottom-fermented, natural cloudy beer, fresh from the cave. Although it is strongly liable to the German Purity Law dated 1516 it is different to most other beers, since we are not filtering or pasteurizing it but bring it directly from the brewery to your table.

In order to make your stay a most pleasant one, we serve homemade Swabian delicacies with the freshly brewed beer. You can have a look on our traditional micro brewery directly from your seat in the restaurant and you can join a guided tour upon appointment. There are no separate rooms in our pleasant and friendly pub but we´ll be pleased to reserve the requested number of seats for you in one of our most comfortable places of the pub to make your stay with your friends or collegues most enjoyable.

If you come with a larger group of people you have the opportunity to rent the whole restaurant where we will spoil you with our speciality buffets. It will be a pleasure to help you with the combination of your menue and to create the right atmosphere for your stay. Our catering service will bring our home-made delicacies to ever place you want. We will be pleased to handle the whole organisation of your event. Please do not hesitate to contact us in time so that we have all opportunities to meet your requests.

data.name: Cascadian Schwarzbier
data.description: This black lager combines a big roasted malt character with plentiful additions of aromatic hops. Magnum, Cascade, Columbus, Centennial and Cluster in the kettle, hopback and dry hop additions add a piney, resinous, light citrusy flavor and aroma. A bitter finish contrasts the full malty body.

breweries.name: Jack's Abby Brewing
breweries.description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

data.name: Cherny Bock
data.description: The word Cherny litteraly means ‘black‘ in Czech referring to the color of the rather surprising dark Schwartzbeir with gentle bitterness to appeal your palette.  A true gem to be discovered by specialty beer lovers.  2008 GABF Silver medal winner in the Schwarzbier category.

data.name: Cobbs Hill Black Lager
data.description: Cobbs Hill Park is the spot to follow your passion - be it working out, having winter fun or creating the perfect jam with guitars and bongos. This is our own “jam” inspired by this Rochester destination. Please enjoy the rich malt ﬂavor and noble hops found in this smooth, yet utterly quaffable, dark lager and feel the groove we are laying down for you.

breweries.description: Ales with character.  Characters with ales. Three Heads Brewing is dedicated to one thing…making great beer.

data.name: Colbitzer Heide-Schwarzbier
data.description:
Colbitzer "Heather Black Beer" is a unique specialty with a distinctive character. Selected special malts give the dark color and the spicy malt flavor. The special brewing process of crystal clear water and fine heath guarantees the highest quality ingredients and great taste.
The coveted Colbitzer "heath-black beer" has been awarded since 2005 for the excellent quality of the Gold Award of the DLG, making it one of the best beers in Germany.

breweries.name: Georgetown Brewing Company
breweries.description: Georgetown Brewing Company, a Seattle microbrewery and brewer of Manny's Pale Ale. We're a draft beer only production brewery, which means that all we do is make beer and fill kegs. Sorry, no brewpub, but we do have a retail shop where you can pick up kegs to go, growlers, and perhaps get a taste of our newest beer before it's released. Or you could be social and get out to your favorite local watering hole. If they don't have our beer on tap, let us know and we'll do our best to pester 'em into submission. Do we bottle? Not yet but we never say never. Right now we're focused on doing one thing right... draft beer. Cheers!

breweries.name: Žatec Brewery
breweries.description:
Dear visitor,
Zatec is an area which has become famous for its hops. The first hops were grown in 1004 and the brewing followed shortly. The combination of the dark red soil, rich in ferrous oxide (which retains water) and climate allows the region to produce the award winning crop.
The Zatec brewery - built in 1801 - is situated inside the Zatec castle walls, overlooking the town and hop fields.
The brewery suffered for lack of investment during the Communist years until by 2000 the brew was hardly available even locally, much to the detriment of the Zatec economy. In year 2001 Rolf Munding purchased the brewery from a local business man and began a program of investment which has rejuvenated the brewery and improved the prospects for the beer, brewery and the people of Zatec, both as beer drinkers and brewers.
Tomas Lejsek, one of Czech Republic’s leading and most innovative brew masters has masterminded the changes, bringing together new technology, old brewing processes and pure ingredients.

data.name: Dark Helmet
data.description: The Dark Helmet is a delicious schwarzbier (black beer) that treats the drinker to an ultra-smooth, velvety lager that features chocolate and coffee notes.  Finishing very clean, this easy-drinking, moderately hopped black beer lends itself to session consumption… in other words, go ahead – have another.

breweries.name: Olde Main Brewing Co.
breweries.description: At Olde Main Brewing Co. we believe, it's not about the next beer, it's about enjoying the one in your hand. That's why head brewer Jeff "Puff" Irvin and brewer "Big John" Rundall blend traditional brewing practices and modern techniques to craft fresh, full-flavored beers. Taste the true deliciosity at bars, restaurant, and retail stores across Iowa or at the Ames brewery and restaurant.

breweries.name: The Brew Kettle, Taproom and Smokehouse
breweries.description: The BREW Kettle opened its doors in the fall of 1995 as Ohio's First Brew-On-Premise Microbrewery.  From that first day it has been our goal to provide our customers with the guidance, equipment and the freshest ingredients to produce quality, hand-crafted beers in an environment that is professional, safe and fun.  Fourteen years and 35,000 batches later, we are still committed to our customers' needs and desires. We invite you to visit our brewery to have a "look-see", visit with our expert brewing staff, or try brewing a batch from our "tried-and-true" recipe list.  we guarantee you'll be hooked!

data.name: Dark Helmet
data.description: Dark Helmet is a German-style black lager (or Schwarzbier) brewed with 10% malted rye. Chocolate and Carafa malts give this beer its dark color and ludicrously smooth, roasty flavor. May the Schwarz be with you!

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: German-Style Schwarzbier
style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. This is not a fullbodied beer, but rather a moderate body gently enhances malt flavor and aroma with low to moderate levels of sweetness. Hop bitterness is low to medium in character. Noble-type hop flavor and aroma should be low but perceptible. There should be no fruity esters. Diacetyl should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Westbrook Brewing Company
breweries.description: Westbrook Brewing is a new craft brewery in Mt. Pleasant, SC. Our mission is to make the most interesting, drinkable, and generally awesome beer possible. We love experimenting with different ingredients and brewing techniques, and we hope you’ll have as much fun drinking our beer as we do making it.

data.name: Dark Helmet Schwartzbier
data.description:
This German-style black lager has a rich aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel, and toasted malt, medium-full body, and a roasty yet smooth finish.

Bronze medalist in the Great American Beer Festival.

breweries.name: Titletown Brewing
breweries.description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

breweries.name: San Miguel Corporation
breweries.description:
Established in 1890, La Fabrica de Cerveza de San Miguel, Southeast Asia's first brewery produced and bottled what would eventually become one of the bestselling beers in the region. Within the span of a generation, San Miguel Beer would become an icon among beer drinkers.

By 1914, San Miguel Beer was being exported from its headquarters in Manila to Shanghai, Hong Kong and Guam. A pioneer in Asia, San Miguel established a brewery in Hong Kong in 1948, the first local brewer in the crown colony.

Today, San Miguel Beer--the Company's flagship product--is one of the largest selling beers and among the top 10 beer brands in the world. While brewing beer is the company's heritage, San Miguel subsequently branched out into the food and packaging businesses.

breweries.name: RAM Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
The Ram is a private, independent, family-owned and operated restaurant business. We were born on February 26, 1971 when our founders took their entrepreneurial spirit and experiences they received making pizza and serving beer at Shakey’s Pizza Parlor to open their own restaurant. That first restaurant was called the Ram Pub, which was a “Deluxe Tavern” that served hot food, including cook-your-own burgers and steaks, along with beer and wine.


Since 1971, the Ram’s primary commitment has been to always provide our guests with superior quality food and gracious hospitality. Although Big Horn Brewing Company is now one of the largest brewpub companies in the country, the goal of our brewers continues to be to produce the freshest, most “drinkable” beer of the highest quality.

breweries.name: Royal Oak Brewery
breweries.description:
The Royal Oak Brewery opened in 1995 in trendy downtown Royal Oak, Michigan. Located one block east of Main Street, it has become an area institution. The comfortable atmosphere and hometown feel make it a destination for locals and visitors alike. The brewery serves 6-7 fresh beers on tap daily.

The Royal Oak Brewery brews our award winning ales and lagers on a 14 Barrel Specific Mechanical system. The brewing system was custom fabricated to fit precisely behind our large bar where our guests can interact with our brewer, Tim Selewski, and enjoy a pint at the same time. With the design of our brewhouse and our state-of-the-art beer delivery system, the Royal Oak Brewery can offer up to 7 house beers on tap at any time. To continue to produce the best possible product, we use only the 4 basic ingredients in our beer: water, malt, hops and yeast. We purchase the highest quality ingredients from around the world to produce the freshest and finest beers available in Oakland County. For more information about our brewery or to setup a tour, please contact our brewmaster, Tim, at the Royal Oak Brewery.

style.name: German-Style Schwarzbier

data.name: Dirtoir Black Lager
data.description:
Jet black in color with a tan head, medium to full bodied, deftly balanced, seamless dark roasted malt flavors with a smooth bitterness, lingering long finish.

Available nationwide on 1-1-2010, Dirtoir Black Lager is the second in the limited availability Chatoe Rogue series. Dirtoir Black Lager and the brews to follow are all GYO Certified, First Growth, Appellation products made with hops and malt from our Department of Agriculture's Hopyard and Barley Bench.

breweries.name: Rogue Ales
breweries.description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

breweries.name: Flying Dog Brewery
breweries.description:
The Flying Dog Legend begins in 1983, and like every good legend there are several versions of this tale. The villains of the peace in this story are two non-conformist, 'not likely to take it lying down' ranchers named George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre.

As George tells it, he and 11 of his closest friends and family decided to embark on what they called an “amateur mountaineering expedition” to climb K2 in the Himalayas. Under-qualified and unprepared, they started their journey with a Sherpa, a donkey, and a suitcase full of contraband. Naturally, half way through the trip the contraband was gone and the Sherpa and donkey had run off, leaving George and his group to fend for themselves. Luckily, everyone managed to make it off the mountain alive, and with a new outlook on life.

Horn Dog Denver Colorado BeerLike any good beer drinker would at the end of an experience like that, George and his group found a local Pakistani hotel bar to have a drink in. Now, alcohol is banned in most Muslim nations, but if you sign an affidavit stating you are the son of a Christian, it’s like a license to drink. George gladly signed away and got down to some serious drinking. That’s about the time he noticed a painting in the Flashman Hotel of a Flying Dog hanging on the wall that had been drawn by a local artist. Now, we all know dogs don’t fly, but nobody told this particular dog it couldn’t fly, just like no one had told George and his friends they couldn’t make this extraordinary journey. The Flying Dog became a symbol that George and his group used to describe what had happened to them with the mantra, “it is amazing what you can achieve if nobody tells you that you can't.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Tours are offered every Thursday and Friday from 4 to 6 pm, along with two sessions on Saturday (12 to 2 pm and 2:30 - 4:30 pm).

data.name: Duck-Rabbit Schwarzbier
data.description: This is a traditional German style dark lager beer. Flavors of chocolate or coffee are common, but usually subtle. Just because the beer is dark, doesn’t mean that the flavors are. Expect the beer to be opaque and black, as the name would imply.

style.name: German-Style Schwarzbier
style.description: These very dark brown to black beers have a mild roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. This is not a fullbodied beer, but rather a moderate body gently enhances malt flavor and aroma with low to moderate levels of sweetness. Hop bitterness is low to medium in character. Noble-type hop flavor and aroma should be low but perceptible. There should be no fruity esters. Diacetyl should not be perceived.

breweries.name: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery
breweries.description: We are a small packaging microbrewery located in Farmville, North Carolina. We sold our first beer in August of 2004. We specialize in beautiful, delicious, full flavored dark beers. When we brew, we’re happy and we dance. During fermentation, we sing softly to the yeast. Please try our beer and enjoy a taste of contentment!

data.name: Einsiedler Schwarzbier St. Peter
data.description:
From an old recipe, the Einsiedler  brew house make this full of seeds, darken special beer with the fine roasted aroma of dark malts.  Connoisseurs like black beer because of its plesant taste and easy digestability. 11,8 % Stammwürze, 
29 Bittereinheiten.

data.name: Empire Schwarzbier
data.description: This is a traditional German Style Schwarzbier.  Made with unhusked roasted barley to impart a subtle roasted charachter without bitterness.  Very delicate on the palate with hints of coffee and chocolate.

breweries.name: Empire Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Empire Brewing Company began as a contemporary Microbrewery & Restaurant in Syracuse, New York. Established in 1994, we have served our national & international award winning ales & lagers exclusively to the craft beer pallets of Central New York.
In 2010, we expanded our proprietary brewing practice to Brooklyn, NY. We are excited to offer you the fruits of our labor in a pint glass. Thank you for your patronage & please enjoy responsibly.

Cheers!
empire brewing company

breweries.name: Territorial Brewing Company
breweries.description: German-inspired beer and cuisine crafted with our city’s heritage of greatness in mind.

data.name: Freibergisch Schwarzes Bergbier
data.description: In Saxony’s mountain capital, the Mountain Beer Festival was a day of joyous celebration. From this tradition comes our Schwarzes Bergbier. As fresh as joy, as aromatic as a beautiful summer day, and so dark that stars twinkle in the glass. Enjoy an excellent beer made in the brewing style of Freiberg. Brewed in accordance with the German purity law.
